billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION

title: Relates to prohibiting good behavior allowances for certain felony offenses
summary: Relates to prohibiting good behavior allowances for violent felony offenses.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1986

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  GOLDEN,  DeFRANCISCO,  JOHNSON,  LAVALLE, LITTLE,
         MAZIARZ, RANZENHOFER, SALAND -- read twice and  ordered  printed,  and
         when  printed to be committed to the Committee on Crime Victims, Crime
         and Correction

       AN ACT to amend the correction law and the penal  law,  in  relation  to
         prohibiting good behavior allowances for certain offenses and increas-
         ing penalties for certain violent felonies

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (c) of  subdivision  1  of  section  803  of  the
    2  correction law, as added by chapter 3 of the laws of 1995, is amended to
    3  read as follows:
    4    (c)  A  person  serving  a  determinate  sentence  of imprisonment may
    5  receive time allowance against the term of his sentence  not  to  exceed
    6  one-seventh  of the term imposed by the court; PROVIDED HOWEVER, THAT NO
    7  PERSON CONVICTED OF A VIOLENT FELONY OFFENSE PURSUANT TO  SECTION  70.02
    8  OF THE PENAL LAW SHALL BE ELIGIBLE FOR GOOD BEHAVIOR ALLOWANCES PURSUANT
    9  TO THIS SECTION OR ANY OTHER SECTION OF LAW.
   10    S  2.  Subdivision  3  of section 70.08 of the penal law is amended by
   11  adding a new paragraph (a-2) to read as follows:
   12    (A-2) WHERE THE PREDICATE VIOLENT FELONIES ARE AT  LEAST  CLASS  B  OR
   13  ABOVE, A DEFENDANT CONVICTED OF AGGRAVATED ASSAULT UPON A POLICE OFFICER
   14  OR  A  PEACE OFFICER PURSUANT TO SECTION 120.11 OF THIS CHAPTER SHALL BE
   15  SENTENCED TO LIFE WITHOUT PAROLE PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FIVE OF SECTION
   16  70.00 OF THIS ARTICLE.
   17    S 3. Subdivision 5 of section 70.00 of the penal law,  as  amended  by
   18  chapter 482 of the laws of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
   19    5.   Life  imprisonment  without  parole.  Notwithstanding  any  other
   20  provision of law, a defendant sentenced  to  life  imprisonment  without
   21  parole  shall  not  be  or  become  eligible  for  parole or conditional
   22  release. For purposes of commitment and custody, other than  parole  and

                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04285-01-1

       S. 1986                             2

    1  conditional  release,  such sentence shall be deemed to be an indetermi-
    2  nate sentence.  A defendant may be sentenced to life imprisonment  with-
    3  out  parole  upon conviction for the crime of murder in the first degree
    4  as  defined in section 125.27 of this chapter and in accordance with the
    5  procedures provided by law for imposing a sentence  for  such  crime.  A
    6  defendant  must  be  sentenced  to life imprisonment without parole upon
    7  conviction for the crime of terrorism as defined in  section  490.25  of
    8  this  chapter,  where the specified offense the defendant committed is a
    9  class A-I felony; the crime of criminal possession of a chemical  weapon
   10  or biological weapon in the first degree as defined in section 490.45 of
   11  this  chapter;  or  the  crime  of  criminal use of a chemical weapon or
   12  biological weapon in the first degree as defined in  section  490.55  of
   13  this  chapter; provided, however, that nothing in this subdivision shall
   14  preclude or prevent a sentence of  death  when  the  defendant  is  also
   15  convicted  of  the  crime  of  murder  in the first degree as defined in
   16  section 125.27 of this chapter.  A defendant must be sentenced  to  life
   17  imprisonment  without  parole upon conviction for the crime of murder in
   18  the second degree as defined in subdivision five of  section  125.25  of
   19  this  chapter or for the crime of aggravated murder as defined in subdi-
   20  vision one of section  125.26  of  this  chapter.  A  defendant  may  be
   21  sentenced  to  life  imprisonment without parole upon conviction for the
   22  crime of aggravated murder as defined  in  subdivision  two  of  section
   23  125.26  of  this chapter.  A DEFENDANT MUST BE SENTENCED TO LIFE WITHOUT
   24  PAROLE UPON A CONVICTION OF AGGRAVATED ASSAULT UPON A POLICE OFFICER  OR
   25  A  PEACE  OFFICER PURSUANT TO SECTION 120.11 OF THIS CHAPTER, WHERE SUCH
   26  CONVICTION IS THE THIRD VIOLENT FELONY OFFENSE FOR WHICH  THE  DEFENDANT
   27  HAS BEEN CONVICTED.
   28    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately; provided, that the amend-
   29  ments to paragraph (c) of subdivision 1 of section 803 of the correction
   30  law  made  by section one of this act shall not affect the expiration of
   31  such section and shall be deemed to expire therewith; provided,  further
   32  however  that  the  amendments  to subdivision 3 of section 70.08 of the
   33  penal law made by section two of this act shall survive  the  expiration
   34  and reversion of such subdivision as provided in section 74 of chapter 3
   35  of the laws of 1995, as amended.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the correction law and the penal law, in relation to prohibiting good behavior allowances for certain offenses and increasing penalties for certain violent felonies
